Name: Velton's Coffee - Treehouse Drip Blend Coffee
Description: Velton's Treehouse Blend Coffee is produced by a small roastery focused on quality control at every turn. Only the highest quality beans are considered. All of Velton's coffee is roasted in small batches, hand blended, and promptly packaged in the highest quality bags (with one-way degassing valve) to ensure maximum freshness.

Name: Caffe Ladro - Ladro Espresso - 12 ounces
Description: Try a sip of Seattle, embodied in Caffe Ladro's signature espresso blend. Ladro Espresso is a little spot of sunshine on a stormy day. By itself it is creamy and sweet with mild chocolate flavor. In a milk-based drink it adds layers of flavor without the addition of sweetener or syrups. It makes a balanced espresso or a full-bodied drip coffee.

Name: Anchorhead Coffee Narwhal House Blend - Whole Bean - 10oz
Description: Anchorheads signature house blend- this coffee will greet you with a the pleasant aroma of ripe cherry. This translates beautifully to your cup where you will also find notes a rich chocolate and creamy nougat. Reminiscent of an old school favorite treat- cherry cordial- this blend is truly a delight.

Name: Slate Coffee Roasters Cream and Sugar Drip Coffee Blend
Description: Put down the cream and toss the sugar, because Slate Coffee's Cream and Sugar drip coffee blend has arrived to be your everything. For those that have been considering giving up the extras and switching to strictly coffee, Slate's Cream and Sugar blend is a good place to start! Roasted to be an easy drinking coffee, you may detect hints of dark chocolate, toasted almond and sweet caramel through this crowd pleaser.

Name: Verve Coffee Roasters The 1950 Blend
Description: A delicious blend with a flavor profile that takes you back in time with notes of brown sugar, clove and peach. It has a dense sweetness and complexity that is perfect when paired with milk or even as espresso.

Name: Counter Culture Coffee Big Trouble
Description: Deliciously sweet, this clean low-acid coffee is named not for its difficulty to brew, but for the challenge the Counter Culture coffee buyers face in sourcing just the right beans for this blend. Designed to remind you of a traditional Italian espresso, Big Trouble combines those chocolatey, nutty flavors loved by so many to create an amazing cup no matter how it is brewed- pour over, french press, espresso- choose your favorite!

Name: Counter Culture Coffee Fast Forward
Description: Developed to introduce coffee drinkers to new coffees from Latin America, Counter Culture's Fast Forward is a blend only the freshest coffees specially selected for a sweet and nutty flavor profile. For those coffee drinkers that like coffee with a little lighter body and a simple consistency to their brew.

Name: Elm Coffee Roasters - Nine Swans
Description: A seasonal blend of coffees that is sourced and roasted to be approachable for coffee drinkers that enjoy espresso or brewed coffee. Sweet and full-bodied with notes of chocolate and fruit, it is sure to be a crowd pleaser or a delicious everyday cup.

Name: Velton's Coffee - Three Ravens Blend - Decaf Espresso
Description: Velton's Three Ravens Blend Decaf Espresso is produced by a small roastery focused on quality control at every turn. Only the highest quality beans are considered. All of Velton's coffee is roasted in small batches, hand blended, and promptly packaged in the highest quality bags (with one-way degassing valve) to ensure maximum freshness.

Name: Middle Fork Roasters Back Pedal Brew - Whole Bean
Description: Back Pedal Brew by Middle Fork Roasters is a blend of Brazilian and Sumatran coffee beans. This popular medium roast coffee has a sweet floral finish with rich bourbon and molasses undertones.

Name: Lavazza Crema e Aroma
Description: Lavazza Crema e Aroma is a creamy and aromatic coffee blend with delicious aroma, smooth flavor and consistent long-lasting crema. Lavazza's premium coffee blends Central and South American Arabicas with select Robustas from Africa to create a full-flavored coffee.

Name: Lavazza Caffe Espresso - Whole Bean
Description: Caffe Espresso is coming to the rescue of dark roast loving, superautomatic using, coffee drinkers everywhere! While a medium roast coffee, it is Lavazza's darkest roast and these darker tendencies produce a rich body with a fragrant aroma. The 100% Arabica blend from Central and South America makes it ideal for espresso (superautomatic or otherwise!), but will create a delicious cup o' coffee with any preparation method. So, what are you waiting for? Show the world your darker side...of coffee, that is!

Name: Lavazza Qualita Oro Espresso
Description: Qualita Oro Espresso is the signature Lavazza blend of 100% Arabica, combining prestigious coffees from Central America with some African varieties chosen for their intense aroma. Qualita Oro has a cup character that is mellow with a pleasant floral hint, typical of the Central American coffee origins.

Name: Lavazza Dek Espresso Decaf
Description: Lavazza Dek Decaf Espresso Whole Bean coffee offers a well-balanced blend from Asia. Full-bodied, long-lasting flavor for those who want to avoid caffeine without giving up delicious Italian coffee. Lavazza uses a modern process of decaffeination with carbon dioxide that does not diminish the flavor and aroma of the roasted coffee beans, a potential downfall of the Swiss water process. The use of carbon dioxide and pure water also avoids the use of potentially harmful substances in the decaffeination process. What to expect from Lavazza's Dek Decaf? A medium-bodied, full flavored espresso roast with no bitter aftertaste. Amaze your friends and family, they won't believe it is decaffeinated. Try a taste test and see! Dek Decaf beans also blend well with your favorite roast to create a custom 50/50 half decaf option.

Name: Lavazza Pienaroma Espresso
Description: Lavazza Pienaroma Espresso is a 100% Arabica blend from the finest premium Arabicas grown in Brazil, the Caribbean and Central America. It produces a creamy, smooth coffee with a sweet and pleasantly acidic body. The low caffeine content and delicate flavor make Pienaroma easy to drink without additives like milk or sugar. It works well as an after dinner coffee and is delicious when paired with desserts.

Name: Lavazza Top Class Espresso
Description: Lavazza Top Class is a full-bodied espresso coffee with a very intense and persistent aftertaste. This select blend of fine Arabicas and special washed Robustas from Java results in a rich flavor and aroma. It makes a dense crema, enjoyable whether you sip espresso or milky cappuccinos.

Name: Lavazza Gran Espresso
Description: Lavazza Gran Espresso blend is made with Arabica beans from Central and South America, combined with African and Indonesian Robustas. Consistent cup after cup, Lavazza Gran Espresso is strong... but not to be confused with dark and oily, this is light and flavorful.

Name: Lavazza Qualita Rossa Espresso
Description: Lavazza Qualita Rossa Espresso is a full bodied espresso. The African Robusta coffee beans give it body and a chocolate aroma, while the natural Arabica from the Brazilian highlands contribute body and a mild aroma. Lavazza roasting brings it all together to create a velvety sensation for your palette. It is the perfect blend for breakfast because it goes well with milk-based drinks and is excellent with biscotti or other bakery goodies.

Name: illy Monoarabica - Single Origin Whole Bean Coffee - Guatemala
Description: Illy Caffe procures sustainably grown Arabica beans exclusively from the Huehuetenango region of Guatemala. The western highlands of Guatemala are a well-know coffee producing area, and these specialty beans add a hint of sweet and spiciness to many existing coffee blends. On its own as a 100% single origin product it is easy to discern sweet flavors in tandem with a barely perceptible chipotle undertone in this lightly roasted full-bodied coffee. It makes a smooth cup with no bitterness.

Name: illy Monoarabica - Single Origin Whole Bean Coffee - Ethiopia
Description: Illy Caffe takes Arabica beans grown exclusively in the Yirgacheffe region of Eastern Ethiopia and roasts them on their own to highlight their unique flavor profile, while also adding aroma to many existing coffee blends. On their own they shine as a 100% single origin product and it is easy to discern citrus notes of lemons and limes in the aroma of this lightly roasted medium-bodied coffee.

Name: Zoka Coffee - Zoka Java Coffee Blend
Description: Zoka Coffee brings a new twist to the classic Mocha Java blend in their signature Zoka Java interpretation. As one of the most well known and historic coffee blends, how does Zoka Coffee, a small artisan roaster in Seattle, improve upon perfection? Zoka took the flavor profile and re-imagined it with what is available now in sustainable agriculture. Instead of coffee from the island of Java, they found a savory, syrupy source in Indonesia. For the bright fruit forward component they bypassed Yemen in favor of Ethiopia. If you are not familiar with the flavor, Zoka Java has a balanced flavor: full earthy body, moderate acidity, nut-like chocolaty flavors and fruity floral high notes.

Name: Zoka Coffee - Fitzroy's Blend
Description: In a town known for deep dark drip coffee, Zoka Coffee created a standout in Fitzroy's Blend. It has the requisite notes of intense dark chocolate and smoke, but transformed into a medium-bodied coffee. There is a fine acidity present with a sweet and persistent aftertaste.

Name: Zoka Coffee - Tuscan Blendd
Description: Zoka Coffee's Tuscan Blend is a dark roast with smoky, dark chocolate notes and a sweet finish. It is smooth (smooooth, perhaps with 4 O's for emphasis) with no bitterness and has quite a caffeinated kick at the end. It makes for a perfect afternoon pick-me-up for those who need a little extra help getting through the day.
